intro: Cuthbertia graminea f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered cuthbertia, is a rare and ornamental grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and striking white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun. Its unique floral display makes it a sought-after species in botanical gardens and specialized collections. Due to its limited natural range, it is often cultivated for its aesthetic value and conservation significance.
